thread.title: College Notebook: HCCC soccer star Somow honored
thread.title_full: College Notebook: HCCC soccer star Somow honored

author: Ron Moshier
title: College Notebook: HCCC soccer star Somow honored
text: Follow @@OD_Moshier Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 10:58 PM Midfielder Moulid Somow (Utica/Thomas R. Proctor), a sophomore who helped the nationally-ranked Herkimer County Community College men’s soccer team extend its winning streak to seven games, was named the National Junior College Athletic Association (NJCAA) Region III Athlete of the Week on Tuesday. After scoring his first goal of the season in HCCC’s 2-0 victory over Broome Community College, Somow had two goals and two assists in an 8-1 win over Mohawk Valley Community College on Peter McAvoy Night at Wehrum Stadium. Entering Wednesday night’s home game against Jefferson Community College, the Generals were 10-2 overall and ranked fifth in the NJCAA Division III poll. They also had outscored teams 38-1 during their seven-game winning streak. Somow had started HCCC’s first 12 games and had three goals and five assists for the Generals, who host unbeaten and top-ranked Genesee Community College at 3 p.m. Saturday at Wehrum Stadium. Morrisville State College goalkeeper Rob Larkin (Clinton) made six saves in a 2-0 win over Utica College. Larkin improved his record to 5-1-2 with his third shutout of the season and the 17th of his career. Women’s Soccer William Smith College junior Shay Callahan (Holland Patent) scored her second goal of the season as the Herons – 9-1-1 and ranked No. 6 in the NCAA Division III poll – extended their winning streak to eight games with a 5-0 victory over St. Lawrence University. Nazareth College’s Michaela Soules (Camden) scored twice in a 3-1 win over Elmira College. Cazenovia College’s Ciera Sportello (Newport/West Canada Valley) scored her third goal of the season in a 3-1 loss to Lancaster Bible College. Kayli Smith (Rome/Rome Free Academy) had a goal and an assist and Nicole Burline (Sauquoit/Sauquoit Valley) also scored as Albany College School of Pharmacy & Health Sciences beat SUNY Cobleskill 9-0. SUNY Delhi’s Katelyn Engelbrecht (Frankfort/Notre Dame) had an assist in a 5-2 win over Paul Smith’s College. Field Hockey Goalkeeper Jess Jecko (Clinton/Sauquoit Valley) will be one of four Syracuse University seniors honored when unbeaten and No. 1 Syracuse (13-0) hosts No. 19 Princeton in SU’s final home game of the season at 3 p.m. Sunday. Last week, Jecko made four saves in a 2-1 win over No. 11 Louisville and had two saves in a 3-1 win over Indiana. SU next hosts No. 7 Wake Forest at 1 p.m. Saturday. Houghton College’s Kristin McKane (Clayville/Mount Markham) scored her seventh goal of the season to give the Highlanders a 1-0 overtime win over Oneonta State. Cortland State freshman Jess Welsh (Hamilton) had back-to-back two-goal games in wins over Houghton College and Brockport State, raising her season total to nine goals. Page 2 of 2 - Ball State University’s Lexi Kavanaugh (Sherrill/Vernon-Verona-Sherrill) scored her seventh goal of the season and added an assist in a 7-1 win over Bellarmine. St. John Fisher College keeper Danielle Famolaro (Rome/Rome Free Academy) made two saves and recorded her second straight shutout in a 2-0 win over Hartwick College. Men’s Golf Junior Derek Bard (New Hartford) shot a 6-under 66 on the second day – matching the lowest round of the tournament – and finished 12th overall to help his 15th-ranked University of Virginia Cavaliers place fourth in a field of 15 teams at the Bank of Tennessee Intercollegiate. Bard, who was in third place after the second round, finished with a 3-under total of 213 (73-66-74). Football Bloomsburg University’s Lawrence Elliott Jr. (Utica/Thomas R. Proctor) rushed for 146 yards and a touchdown on 17 carries as the Division II Huskies beat Millersville University 41-20. Utica College’s Mike Sullivan (Whitesboro) made nine tackles, Nick Woodman (Utica/Thomas R. Proctor) had six tackles and a sack, and Matt McCoy (Sherrill/Vernon-Verona-Sherrill) intercepted a pass – his second pick of the season -- in a 22-19 overtime win over Brockport State. Women’s Tennis Freshman Ella Brutsky (Sauquoit/Sauquoit Valley) was named the Mohawk Valley Community College Athlete of the Week after avenging her only losses of the season and winning an NJCAA Region III title at No. 1 singles. Brutsky rallied to win 1-6, 6-1, 6-1 to qualify for the NJCAA National Championships on Oct. 22-24 in Peachtree City, Georgia. Follow @OD_Moshier on Twitter or call him at 792-5031.
